comments:
This course is an examination of the internal and external factors that influence people\'s behavior in a buying situation. Course objectives are: 1) to provide conceptual understanding of consumer behavior, integrating theories from psychology, sociology, and economics; 2) to provide experience in the application of buyer behavior concepts to marketing management decisions; and 3) to introduce behavioral research approaches.

Students truly enjoyed the content of this class and the introduction to marketing they received. Students stressed that the material they learned “has real-world application and is useful in everyday work.”

Students praised Professor Rechtiene for being an extremely motivating instructor. Students said “passion from the instructor was contagious.” According to many, he was “truly knowledgeable about the subject matter and brought fantastic industry experience.” Students also appreciated his interactive teaching style.

Students said that the class did not have as much work as expected but they would have preferred further notice of upcoming assignments. Furthermore, students suggested that a better book would be beneficial. Overall, students highly recommended this course to anyone wanting to learn more about marketing.
